content: I'm looking to deploy Zulip behind an SSL-terminating load balancer using the docker container (i.e. Nginx will handle my SSL certificate and Zulip will be running in HTTP with access only through NGINX). Is this possible with the current settings?
@redstonedesigner yes, though I think it's less annoying to do that setup if you're not running Zulip in Docker.
https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/deployment.html#putting-the-zulip-application-behind-a-reverse-proxy documents the nginx configuration you want if you're not using Docker.

I think that should be adaptable to docker-zulip using the notes here: https://github.com/zulip/docker-zulip#networking-and-reverse-proxy-configuration

Feedback on the documentation here is appreciated!
